name: Sofitel Melbourne on Collins

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights in a club floor suite for the Melbourne Cup. Certainly not 5 Star...5 star pricing but a 3 star outcome. Good location, great views, club facilities were ok but nothing special. Basic value for money proposition is just not there, can do much better elsewhere. Our mistake.
reviews.title: Overpriced to the max

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Sofitel with my Mum in December 2008 and was very impressed!
reviews.title: Luxurious hotel with lovely views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived in Melbourne at 6am and weren’t expecting to have access to our room until 2pm check-in but lucky for us, the room was ready early!
reviews.title: Stunning Views of Melbourne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The concierge staff were lovely and helpful on check in and check out, and they held our bags for us after we checked out.
reviews.title: Perfecto..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The rooms were lovely – lots of room and nice and clean. We had a great view over Melbourne.
reviews.title: No need to stay anywhere else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is good too – very close to the free tourist circle tram, and not too far to walk down Collins Street to Federation Square or Swanston Street.
reviews.title: Stunning Views With Some Let-Downs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Had a girls day away shopping and booked into the sofitel for a bit of luxury, and we certainly werent dissappointed.Didn't arrive to hotel till 6pm as we had all day shopping and was pleased to discover we had been given an upgrade to junior suite. It was a corner room facing out to MCG and over the Yarra. The view was just superb. The room was well equiped with full mini bar, great bed, dvd,flat screen tv, lounge area was spacious,lots of reading material, and a great writing desk. We had a bath and shower and everything was spotless. Checkin and out was a breeze with very friendly staff. We went for drinks in the bar, and were served nibblies whilst having a drink which was a nice treat. Also dined in the newly renovated restaurant no. 35. We had the taster menu and it was simply superb. Nice to try some different food. We had buffet breakfast the next morning and I will say the selection was limited but the quality of the food is fantastic. We had an advantage plus card which I would definetly recommend puchasing before visiting hotel as it cuts your food bill in 1/2 when 2 people dining.Over all I would give the hotel 10 out of 10 and recommend as a great spurge. I have travelled internationlly and throughout Australia and this would have been up there with the best.I would like to thank the staff who made our stay memorable.
reviews.title: absolutely brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 1 night in a "Club Sofitel" room on the 49th floor. 180° view of the city is stunning. Fantastic bed (Sofitel "MyBed"). Lots of high-tech gadgetry, incl. oversize LCD TV set to which we could plug our digital camera to view our photos. Good breakfast buffet in a panoramic dining room filled with natural light.
reviews.title: Stunning views, great beds, high-tech - a bit cold ?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: All in all, very high level of comfort and decent value for money.
reviews.title: No free wireless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: On the downside, it has an impressive decor that feels a bit cold and lacks a cozy ambiance ... Entrance through the escalators of a shopping mall is not very glamorous, for example.
reviews.title: Poor Service, Dirty Room for supposed '5 star' hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good, central location
reviews.title: My New Fav Hotel in Melbourne..long

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: My last visit at the Sofitel was well over 6 years ago. It used to be my hotel of choice for my trips to the Aust Open. In the last few year, Sofitel was too expensive, so I have stayed at other hotels. I was interested in seeing what the hotel was like after this time.
reviews.title: Statisfed but the hotel is slipping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I enjoyed my stay and was satisfied based on the rate I paid. I would not feel the same level of satisfaction if I had paid more as (apart from the view) I know you can get better deals at other Melbourne hotels.
reviews.title: Sofitel - not perfect but close

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the positive side, the room was clean and cleaned well during my stay. The room was a comfortable size. There was a large flat screen TV that, along with the lighting was all hooked up to one control unit. The bathroom is ample in size and the water pressure is great. They don't skimp on the towels or toiletries either.
reviews.title: Beautiful views in our favourite city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The negatives for me was the bed and bath. I realise these things can't be changed but they are not to my preference. The bed is too soft and you sink into it. Preferring a firmer mattress, I found myself getting out of bed each morning with a back ache. I also found the bathtub a touch too narrow. The shower is above the bath and the narrowness of the bath requires you to be careful when moving around.
reviews.title: Great price and superb stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I felt the Sofitel was lacking in the details that supposedly make it a high-end hotel. It's these things the hotel can change and should pay more attention to. The TV is hooked into a surround sound speaker set up. The wiring was not the best which resulted in scratchy and sometimes total loss of sound. I could fix this by switching the TV on and off, but it should not have happened. The bathroom was showing signs of ages with spots of black in the grouting. Room service was hit and miss. The standard reply is a 30-35 minute wait. The wait was once well in excess of this time, the other time it arrived in what felt like 10 minutes. The panels on some of the furniture was starting to peel away and some of the chairs had chipped legs.
reviews.title: Can't go wrong
Great hotel, let down by some less than stellar staff.
reviews.text: The Sofitel on Collins is a great luxury hotel situated in arguably the nicest part of the Melbourne CBD. The entrance is off of Collins St down a little alleyway, and not quite the grand street frontage you expect from this style of hotel. Once inside though, the lobby is very large and luxuriously furnished, with plush couches to relax on and a very welcoming atmosphere.

reviews.title: Biggest rip-off of the century!
reviews.text: Check in was a breeze and we were pleasantly surprised to see how large the room was - judging by the plan on the fire-escape map on the wall we had scored one of the largest standard guest rooms on the floor. The views from the 43rd floor were also spectacular looking over the MCG and all the way into Melbourne suburbia. The bathroom was clean, apart from a long black hair in the shower, probably left by the cleaner - a 'gift' that was repeated on the next day of our stay, which was a little off-putting. The bathroom was pleasant otherwise, not huge, but nicely fitted out with soothing lighting and a very large shower.

reviews.title: chic and stylish
reviews.text: I need two things for a good night's sleep - a dark room and a nice firm bed. The Sofitel had me covered with the first requirement, with shutters on the window that plunged the room into almost total darkness. The bed however was like a giant marshmallow, and of the usual two-singles-pushed-together type. Each of the individual beds had sunk in the middle due to their extreme softness, leaving us with a bizarre W-shaped bed to suffer through. The pillows at least could be firmed up with a choice from the pillow menu. I have to say, as a person who prefers a firm bed, I found my sleep at the Sofitel truly horrible, waking up with a sore back and twisted neck. If you like a soft bed however, the Sofitel bed will be heaven to you!

reviews.title: Rooms and location ok. Service non existant
reviews.text: We decided to have a couple of cocktails at the spectacular Atrium bar on level 35 of the hotel. The atrium is truly breathtaking and a luxurious place to unwind or start a night. The staff here were also breathtaking in their seeming desire to be any place other than at work. They were slow to take drink orders, seemed horribly inconvenienced when asked about the cocktails on the menu, and were baffled by the fact that the drinks were supposed included as part of our package. The surly looks on their faces as they wandering around the place also didn't help. Thankfully the staff that actually greet the guests at reception where impeccable - helpful, courteous and patient. Nothing was too much trouble for them and every request was fulfilled quickly and with a minimum of fuss.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here in December for three nights. The first night in a classic room then we upgraded to a junior suite with club level access.
reviews.title: Not quite as good as I'd hoped

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: The lobby is 'unusual' you pull up in the taxi and then you dont quite know where to go. Its kind of combined in a shopping centre.
reviews.title: Nice Option for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really didnt know where to stay, I was tossing up between Sofitel, Westin and the Crown.
reviews.title: Wonderful View, Good Location, Small Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009
reviews.text: I cant quite put my finger on it but the sofitel is just lacking 'something', its just not as special as say, the Park Hyatt which just has that wow factor.
reviews.title: Lovely

aka: Sofitel Melbourne On Collins Hotel Melbourne
description: Sofitel Melbourne On Collins is at the Paris end of Collins Street, in the heart of the city's premier shopping, dining and theatre district, just minutes from the famous Melbourne Cricket Ground. This award-winning hotel has 363 luxurious rooms that begin from level 36 offering breathtaking views from floor-to-ceiling windows. Each room is complemented by modern furnishings, mood lighting, LED\LCD or Plasma televisions and iPod|MP3 connection. Marble bathrooms offer automated low level lighting and French amenities.Enjoy modern dining in No35, high tea occasions in Sofi's Lounge or stylish cocktails in the Atrium Bar On 35.For meetings and events, Sofitel Melbourne On Collins is one of the city’s most comprehensive integrated hotel conference venues offering 12 individual meetings venues with comprehensive audio-visual services.
